references.paper_title: Fast approximate energy minimization via graph cuts
references.reason: This paper introduces a fast approximation algorithm for energy minimization via graph cuts, which is fundamental to the GaussianCut method's graph-cut based segmentation approach.

references.paper_title: 3D Gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This paper introduces 3D Gaussian splatting, the core scene representation leveraged by GaussianCut for efficient 3D scene rendering and manipulation.
This paper introduces the Segment Anything Model (SAM), a powerful foundation model used in GaussianCut to generate initial segmentation masks from user inputs.
This paper explores a related approach to 3D Gaussian segmentation, providing valuable context and comparison for GaussianCut's novel contributions.

references.paper_title: Spin-NeRF: Multiview segmentation and perceptual inpainting with neural radiance fields
references.reason: This paper introduces the SPIn-NeRF dataset which is used in the experiments for the proposed method, providing a benchmark for evaluating 3D segmentation performance.
